data.title: [Utility] Add functions for dealing with cabinet files
data.body:
i have a branch for installShield Cabinet files for extracting listing and content of them.
I also planed when #9093 is merged to implement function like:
- Handle (when support is given) microsoft cabinet files
- index per filename lookup and viceversa
- extract files by index or name
- extract an entire Directory

progress so far:

```
arguments used
l = list
is = installshield
d = directory
<filename>
```

```
OpenRA.Utility all --cabfile l is d E:\data1.hdr
```

data.title: Cactus improvement
data.body: Solves the highly debated cactus tooltip issue in Red Alert desert maps. They are finally identified as what they are: cacti. :cactus:

data.title: MAD tanks destroy trees
data.body: Trees are normally indestructable. They are untargetable. Nuke doesn't destroy them.

data.title: D2k vanilla balance pass
data.body:
-- All costs, prerequisites, CustomBuildTimeValue, health, armour, weapon damage, range, warhead values and sight ranges should be D2k accurate
-- Made aircraft and sandworms visible through fog because it is quite oppressive (especially for carryalls)
-- Removed paradrop power, bounty, veterancy
-- Unit names were partially copied from D2k until they got a bit silly, such as upgrade.high_tech_factory
-- Unit speeds were worked out using "unit speed- (([speed value] / 32) / 10) x 1024 / 25", then multiplied by 2 to be a playable speed
-- ROT is a guess, but should be respectful of unit's ROT relative to each other
-- Warhead spreads are as accurate as I could get them through trial and error
-- Gave husks an explosion on death
-- Buildings are no longer automatically targeted (except turrets)
-- Buildings no longer emit Troopers on sale
-- Worms no longer target infantry, spawn less frequently and always disappear after an attack
-- Fixed a couple of cliff tiles that were set to Sand instead of Cliff
-- All Starport units can now be gotten with no other prerequisites
-- The Upgrades queue is now independent of the Con Yard
    - Gave the Building production trait to the player actor as well, so that it will be the first tab to open after deploying a Con Yard. Added construction_yard as prerequisite to necessary buildings. The side effect is that if you use the debug menu to enable the construction of everything you will be able to build and place structures without a Con Yard.

data.title: Mobile Blocking Refactor
data.body:
This is a refactoring in Mobile.cs of the logic used to determine if actors block movement.

This centralises some duplicated logic in `CanMoveFreelyInto` and into `GetAvailableSubCell` into a new method and makes some minor changes to squeeze out a bit more performance as the pathfinder calls `CanMoveFreelyInto` frequently.

This is intended to have no impact on the output of these functions. This means for testing you could record a game on bleed and replaying it with this PR should not desync. That's how I tested it.

data.title: Refactored WaterPaletteRotation into RotationPaletteEffect
data.body:
Moves rotation base index from tileset to palette effect.
Unhardcodes some other aspects.

Fixes #8872.

data.title: Makes trees destructable.
data.body: They have nice damaged state images and death animations which were not used. They can be targeted using force fire.

data.title: Lint check player palette references
data.body: to complete https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/issues/8689.

data.title: stop "Unit Ready" sound spaming when Instant Buildtime is enabled
data.body: By adding the missing condition... Normal mode works as expected...

data.title: Fix WithCargo desync.
data.body:
Adjusting world state from render code is a bad idea.
Closes #9094.

data.title: Humanlike Infantry will get produced in kennels
data.body:
I discovered a bug when the player build ONLY a kennel but no barracks he can produce tanya and infantry from it.

Reproduce case:
- enable devbuildall cheat
- build a kennel and barracks
- sell the barracks

we should also ensure that infantry can only produced in barracks regardless of having cheats enabled or not.

data.title: Fix TerrainTypes for walls and crates
data.body:
This Pr fixes a bug where walls can not be placed on some terrainTypes 

good example are the new TS maps. where we cant place walls on terrain types like `Sand, Green, Road, Pavement, Rough` and so on.

data.title: Hides crates under fog.
data.body:
Crates are hidden under fog of war like units. So to find them, scouting of the map is required. Also adds a satellite icon for crates. They are shown as white empty squares.

![crate_icon](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/6599106/9300127/65334094-44cb-11e5-84b0-55de723d295d.png)

This is the enlarged view of the image I used for the icon:
![crate_icon_source](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/6599106/9300212/4cb56eec-44cc-11e5-9152-99af3e569cd5.png)

What I don't understand however is that gpsdot.shp got smaller after I added the crate image. How did that happen?

data.title: Make devmode configureable, add two commands and documentate some things
data.body:
This Pr adds adds the ability to make some cheats configureable:
- The amount of cash
- Growrate of world resources
- Enable or Disable the report when developer commands was used.

In addition this PR adds the following commands:
- disablecheats -> Disable cheat mode
- fragilealliances -> Disable or Enable Diplomancy options

Also some settings was documented.

data.title: Desync when Cargo.InitialUnits is used
data.body:
Game Crash when i build modded Plane
 on this version: "Civillian Outrage BETA 48a"   http://resource.openra.net/maps/4168
out of sync

data.title: Improve TFD Installation logic
data.body:
This Pr adds more flexibilty to the TFD Installer when installing content from TFD discs. by using index lookup. Closes https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/issues/9082. 

also this Pr pays attention to:  https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/pull/8170#issuecomment-129621166

data.title: Some more renaming from "race" to "faction"
data.body:
Next step toward #7873.
This takes care of the last occurrences of "race" in class member names (except `PlayerProperties.Race`, which will stay until the release is out, I guess).
Split into nice small commits for easy reviewing.

data.body: See the label widget at the top of the screen.

data.title: Isometric cliff shadow
data.body:
In Tiberian Sun the cliffs cast a shadow which is a separate overlay. Those are currently missing.

data.title: Parallaxing ingame background
data.body:
For space mods it would be exceptionally nice to be able to set per-map parallaxing background images, perhaps using loading screen code, so we could set different layers that can scale or tile appropriately.

Rather than having a black background beneath tiles, it renders this background image instead.

With this we could make tiles that use the transparent colour, displaying this image through them, but also contain graphics of closer space objects to help create the depth and nice layering.

Use cases: http://www.ppmforums.com/viewtopic.php?t=38137&start=90 & http://www.ppmforums.com/viewtopic.php?t=35811 (if put into RA2/YR mod as Phrohdoh expressed interest)

Also with the option to control the amount images parallax, this could in theory also be used to replace water visually. With a parallax of 0 and some nice water texture with a sky reflection, it could look quite nice!
## <bountysource-plugin>

Want to back this issue? **[Post a bounty on it!](https://www.bountysource.com/issues/25830672-parallaxing-ingame-background?utm_campaign=plugin&utm_content=tracker%2F36085&utm_medium=issues&utm_source=github)** We accept bounties via [Bountysource](https://www.bountysource.com/?utm_campaign=plugin&utm_content=tracker%2F36085&utm_medium=issues&utm_source=github).
</bountysource-plugin>

data.title: Investigate using MoonSharp instead of a custom Eluant
data.body:
I haven't done any experiments, but at first glance there seem to be some benefits from using @xanathar's http://www.moonsharp.org/ vs. our https://github.com/OpenRA/Eluant fork:
- Hopefully proper stacktraces with not just line numbers in the script wrapper, but the map script code.
- It looks well maintained with Nuget packages available.
- We don't need to worry about system Lua anymore as it is written in C# like KopiLua.
- Seems to have been designed for sandboxing and games in the first place.
- Linux packaging (unbundling dependencies) is easier with a standardized upstream.
## <bountysource-plugin>

Want to back this issue? **[Post a bounty on it!](https://www.bountysource.com/issues/25828305-investigate-using-moonsharp-instead-of-a-custom-eluant?utm_campaign=plugin&utm_content=tracker%2F36085&utm_medium=issues&utm_source=github)** We accept bounties via [Bountysource](https://www.bountysource.com/?utm_campaign=plugin&utm_content=tracker%2F36085&utm_medium=issues&utm_source=github).
</bountysource-plugin>

data.title: RA mod balance changes
data.body:
In response to the ongoing discussion at http://www.sleipnirstuff.com/forum/viewtopic.php?f=82&t=18117
This is the first of a series of incremental balance changes as proposed by various members of the community.

Hijacker;
-cost increased from $500 to $600
-speed increased to 71 
-stealthed when not moving

Shock trooper;
-cost increased from $400 to $500
-health reduced to 80 from 100

Heavy tank
-cost reduced from $1150 to $1050
-health increased from 550 to 575

Yak
-chaingun spread increased from 128 to 298

data.body: Partially addresses https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/issues/6145.

data.title: How can i get the CabfileIDs for German TFD DVDs?
data.body:
OpenRA says the Disk was not found... but changelog says support is there :(
something different between german and US disks?!

I looked already in the PR but no one has documented how we can find the IDs and how they are calculated
